#Text=Create a Dance Moms Audio Swap
#Text=If you 've ever seen one of the " Dance Moms " performances , you 'll already know that they dance to certain music that fits the performance .

column1: #Text=In just the same way , you can create a Dance Moms Audio Swap .
#Text=And although less frequently done , you can also use audio swapping in other ways than Dance Moms Audio Swaps .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Preparation
#Text=Get the device(s) needed .
#Text=This is a mobile method , so you will need an Apple device ( or some device with iMovie on it ) .
#Text=This includes : Mac ( computers/laptops ) , iPhone , iPod and iPad .
#Text=Get the apps needed .
#Text=The apps you will need are :
#Text=iMovie ( this may be free in some cases )
#Text=Video download and player - Titan ( sometimes just called " Free Video " ) ( free or premium ) .
#Text=Creating
#Text=Open " Video Download " .

column3:
abstract[64]	giv[64]	_	_
16-3	922-927	Video	person|abstract[64]	giv|giv[64]	_	_
16-4	928-936	Download	abstract[64]	giv[64]	_	_
16-5	937-938

column1: #Text=At the bottom should be a " Browser " tab .
#Text=Tap that .
#Text=Scroll up .
#Text=There is a URL bar and a Google Search bar .
#Text=In Google , search for a Dance Moms number you 'd like to use .
#Text=Tap the video .
#Text=Scroll up and tap and hold the URL of the video .
#Text=A list menu should come up .
#Text=Tap " Download As " and tap the name bar to type .
#Text=You can also just download the video without renaming it .
#Text=You 'll be able to see the video by the thumbnail , so it does n't really matter what you name it .
#Text=After downloading the video(s) , go to " Videos " at the bottom of the application .
#Text=Your videos will come up .
#Text=Tap and hold the video you want to audio swap .
#Text=Tap " Save to camera roll " .
#Text=It can be easy to forget or maybe think you can skip this step , but it is essential , so do n't overlook it .
#Text=Open iMovie .
#Text=Tap the create button ( " + " ) .
#Text=Tap " Movie " .
#Text=On the design " Simple " , tap " Create " .
#Text=Tap the media icon in the top left of your work area .
#Text=You should be on " Video " in the tabs at the bottom of the app .
#Text=Tap " all " and choose the video that you downloaded .
#Text=Tap an arrow that signifies " use " .
#Text=Tap the tab " Audio " at the bottom .
#Text=Choose your song .
#Text=Choose the " use " arrow .
#Text=In your iMovie studio , tap the video .
#Text=Choose the sound icon .
#Text=Turn the sound to 0 % .
#Text=Remove all parts of the video that are not dancing ( the audience , judges , etc. ) .
#Text=You can do this by :
#Text=1. Putting the white work bar line where you are splitting the dance and part that should be taken out .
#Text=This should be done twice unless the part that is being taken out is at the beginning or end .
#Text=2.
#Text=Tapping the part to be removed and tapping " Delete " .
#Text=Choose parts of the dance to move around if you want to change the dance .
#Text=This works the same as parts to be removed ( Step 9 ) .
#Text=Separate parts of the dance .
#Text=Duplicate them .
#Text=Hold them in to move them to a different part of the dance .
#Text=Note :
#Text=When you are moving a part , it can only be placed at separations or at the beginning or end .
#Text=If there is a part of the dance that you would like to remove , but the clip is too short , shorten the part attached to it .
#Text=Fix your song , if it needs to be amended .
#Text=For example , split it , duplicate it , shorten it , and so on .
#Text=Tap the back arrow at the top left of your screen .
#Text=Your work should already be saved .
#Text=Name your work .
#Text=Publish your work .
#Text=This step is optional .
#Text=Tips
#Text=To play the full song ( it gets cut off when the video is too short ) , duplicate the video to be longer .
#Text=Once the song reaches its end , or where you would prefer it to stop , you can remove duplications of the video while keeping the song long .
#Text=Warnings
#Text=People may not like your work .
#Text=If they do n't , just politely tell them that you wanted to create an audio swap , and if they do n't want to watch it , they do n't have to .
#Text=Say it politely though !
#Text=Your work will never be completely perfect – – remember , that does n't make it a bad audio swap .
#Text=You will get better .
#Text=A first audio swap may not be as good as others – – yet .
